sentence.text: Fourteen single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) in three genes were genotyped by the TaqMan method using the real-time PCR system.ResultsThree SNPs G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway-rs11746675, GRM6-rs2067011, and GRM6-rs2645339 were associated with high myopia (odds ratio (OR)=0.74, P=0.003; OR=0.78, P=0.018; and OR=0.78, P=0.023; respectively).

entity.text: G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: The genetic model analysis found that G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway-rs11746675 and GRM6-rs2067011 were suggestively associated with high myopia in the recessive model (OR=0.54, P=0.004; OR=0.52, P=0.003; respectively).

entity.text: G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: Haplotype glycine metabolic process for G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway markers rs2067011-rs2645339-rs762724 showed significance (P=0.0239), but such association did not remain significant after multiple testing corrections.ConclusionsOur data suggested that genetic variants in GRM6 are associated with high myopia.

entity.text: G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: The mechanism of G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway in the development of high myopia need to be further investigated.

entity.text: G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway
